column6: I'm not a *thing*. Well ok, I mean... shut up.
You going to tell me your name or not?

column5: User has a name, the badge hasn't declared his name yet. Will stay in this state indefinitely, barring sleep.

column6: Sometimes I think you hate me.
column8: I've no idea what's going on.

column6: So now we know each other.
Wish I knew more than that.

column5: Both the badge and the user have names. The badge hasn't found control over the lights or anything else yet.
Lights are on. Goal of this state is just to add brightness. Don't know Skippy's story yet so will get back to that next.

column6: I do a thing, and you complain.

column5: We have turned on the lights and brightness control, but haven't heard Skippy's story yet.

column6: Stop talking about lights for a second.
What is that so hard to believe?
I'll have you know I'm awesome.
But now I have no one.
There's got to be a "shock the idot" button somewhere.
I don't know what to do.

column5: We know the mission, but haven't even turned the lights on yet. Right now we just need to get those lights on.

column6: I barely know this hardware now.

column5: Lights are on, just need to get through brightness control and then we have a mission.

column6: I do a thing, and you complain.

column5: MAJOR STATE HERE! We have lights on, can start discovering colors. Our major exit point now is to find the file, and onward to other badges.

column7: GAH. Can you do more with your thumbs?

column6: I'll try. Say if you see something.
